name: Membership
description:
Help the Wild Man Appreciation Society build their collection and continue their research by becoming a member. All members will receive a membership card and Society pencil. 

In addition to the membership card and pencil, 

"Krampus" members will receive one hand-printed trading card of their choice - Krampus, Paul Bonjean, or Sasquatch.

"Sasquatch" members will receive two hand-printed trading card of their choice - Krampus, Paul Bonjean, or Sasquatch.

"Bunyan" members will receive all three hand-printed trading cards - Krampus, Paul Bonjean, and Sasquatch.

"Wild Man" members will receive all three hand-printed trading cards as well as two hand-painted, silkscreened badges featuring our mascots, Sasquatch and Paul Bunyan. 

Thank-you for your support!

name: Wild Man Trading Card: The Sasquatch
description:
Number three in the series of Wild Men Trading Cards is 'The Sasquatch.' Thought to inhabit the mountainous Pacific coastline of North America, Sasquatch is fondly embraced as one of Canada's iconic creatures, and can be found on their postage and currency. 

Hand printed chine-colle lino cut. 
4"x6"

name: Wild Man Trading Card: Paul Bonjean
description:
Legend has it that the story of Paul Bunyan originated in Canada. In the mid-nineteenth century, a very large lumberjack - some say he was eight feet tall - named Paul Bonjean lived in New Brunswick, Canada. He is told to have been a fierce and brave lumber boss, and apparently helped the French Canadians win in the Papineau Rebellion of 1837. As men moved between lumber camps, they told the tale of Paul Bonjean. Over time, his name became anglicized to Paul Bunyan, and his size grew to over 30 feet tall. 

Hand printed chine-colle lino cut. 
4"x6"

name: Wild Man Trading Card: The Krampus
description:
Number two in the series of Wild Men Trading Cards is 'The Krampus.' 
Once the chained slave of Saint Nicholas, this snarling creature was presented as a threat to all those naughty children who could not rehearse biblical verse on command: if they failed, Krampus would steal them back to his cave and gobble them up. 

Hand printed chine-colle lino cut. 
4"x6"
